questions.question: What is focal length?
options: The distance from your subject to the camera
The distance (at infinity focus) from the lens's optical center to the sensor
The size of the camera sensor
The diameter of the lens mount
questions.reviewHint: Focal length is a property of the lens, defined at infinity focus.

questions.question: As focal length increases, your field of view…
You stand in the same spot and switch from 35 mm to 70 mm. What changes?
options: Framing gets tighter (subject looks bigger); perspective doesn't change because you didn't move
Depth of field becomes identical to 35 mm
questions.reviewHint: Perspective depends on camera position, not focal length.

questions.question: What primarily controls perspective (how near/far objects appear relative to each other)?
Hand-holding rule of thumb on full frame: with a 100 mm lens, use at least…
On a 1.5× crop camera with a 100 mm lens, a safe hand-held shutter is about…
Which focal lengths are typically wide-angle on full frame?
questions.reviewHint: <35 mm on full frame is wide.

questions.question: A popular portrait focal length on full frame (flattering perspective, comfortable working distance) is:
questions.reviewHint: 85 mm is a classic head-and-shoulders choice.

questions.question: Which is true about zoom vs prime lenses?
options: A prime has variable focal length; zoom is fixed
A prime has a fixed focal length (often smaller, faster); a zoom covers a range
Zooms always have wider maximum apertures
questions.reviewHint: Primes = fixed FL, often wider max aperture; zooms = flexible framing.

questions.question: Does focal length itself create "background compression"?
options: Yes, longer focal length compresses regardless of distance
No—"compression" mainly comes from standing farther away; longer FLs are often used because you step back
questions.reviewHint: Compression look = greater camera distance (perspective), not FL alone.

questions.question: Your lens won't focus on a very close subject at 200 mm. Most likely you're…
options: Inside the lens's minimum focus distance—step back or use macro gear
questions.reviewHint: Every lens has a minimum focus distance (MFD).

questions.question: Without moving the camera and at the same f-number, increasing focal length generally makes the background look…
questions.reviewHint: Longer FL at same position & f-number → greater subject magnification → more blur.
